Reviews.Title: “It's horrible”
Reviews.Author: xiaolan l Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's the worst hotel I stayed in my life.Dirty, no hair dryer, no internet in the room. The alarm is beeping all the time. The bathroom is leaking. The worst thing is there are bugs in the room.

Reviews.Title: “i would never take my child there ever or family there ever or recomend this place to no one”
Reviews.Author: babyhuey1
Reviews.Content: i was awoken to a disterbense on the first floor then i saw 10-15 cops in the builden on the first floor a worker name Huey was there excorting the police to a where to lil girls roughly 3-6yrs old were molested by there uncle on the first floor the rooms also found out a worker there name josh had a master key to the rooms walked into a womens room while she was asleep about 1a-2a asking her if he could sleep with her and found he is into a theft ring taking people stuff from there rooms while guest are not there and he is still there working at the hotel. the heat didnt work in my room and had my to lil boys there and it was cold that night had no phone in the room tv broken and rouches in the hall ways rooms are nasty it seems like the owner name SAM&MADUE are terrible people and they hid the matter of those girls being molested. Huey was the to call the police on that matter grat man a real man.

Reviews.Title: “RUN! Run away!”
Reviews.Author: misslissalu
Reviews.Content: My husband was set to stay at Midway Inn with a sports team, and I came along for the weekend so we sprung for our own room. We arrived around 9 p.m. and were astonished at the disgusting conditions of this place. To give you an idea, there is a sign in the lobby that says you have 5 minutes in which to ask for a refund. Does that sound like a place confident in their amenities? I'm far from a hotel snob, but when we arrived in this gritty part of town and walked into this dump, past the homeless man in the lobby alternately leering at me and falling asleep on a table, I told my husband I really wasn't comfortable staying there and asked if we could leave before we even checked in. I used GPS to find the group of hotels closer to the airport that included some bigger-name hotels, and we actually paid $180 for about 10 hours' stay rather than stay at Midway Inn. The next day we went to pick up some of the guys on the team (we had one of the only rental cars), and when we got to the hotel in the daylight I've got to say I felt completely confident in our decision to chunk almost 2 bills into another hotel! Even in the daylight this hotel is disgusting and creepy. The paint and decor is old and gross. The bathrooms are ancient and toilets sound weird when they flush. I was pregnant at the time and going to the bathroom all the time; whenever we went to the hotel I would hover over the toilet so I didn't have to touch anything in the bathroom. The beds and linens looked dirty and old. Like I said, honestly, I'm not a hotel snob; I have stayed in some places that weren't so great. But this place is absolutely unacceptable. Even the younger, rough-and-tumble guys on the team made fun of the horrible amenities. RUN, run FAR away from this horrible hotel. It is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: nancy b
Reviews.Content: If your planning on staying only 1-2 nights its fine, comfy bed, TV, geat channels, but for week long vacations find something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: dani_usa_2011
Reviews.Content: That place is terrible! My friends found bugs in the bed when they arrived, at 4:00am. They came back to tell the recepcionist about and she didn't care about it. Seems that is commom there. They left the place one hour after they arrived. We are trying to take the full refund but the maneger never can talk with us! Thats have been my worst experience with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't take a hooker there!!!”
Reviews.Author: R54899
Reviews.Content: I've been in alot of motels / hotels in Chicago but this had to be the nastiest place I've ever seen... They only have six channels on tv... No fox, abc,cbs,or nbc so I couldnt watch any football games... I asked for some clean linens and she came back wit some stained ones.. There was blood spats on the ceiling, found a condom under the bed and some poor girl (who had been unfortunate enough to stay there) ID... I wouldnt recommend this place to my worst enemy... Or would I... NAW it's gross!!!!

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay, excellent for the price in that area”
Reviews.Author: joyeoustraveler
Reviews.Content: we saw several negative cooments before our stay but we had a very good experience there. Staff was very friendly and hotel is sort of gated, we felt very safe with our rental car there too. compared to other hotels there for the price, I would recommend if you wish to spend smartly.

Reviews.Title: “THEY ROBBED NAIVE GIRLS.. NEVER GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: ELSY C
Reviews.Content: I prepayed the room with hotels.com with my credit card, so that my daughter who doesn't have a credit card, could go with her friend on a visit to Chicago. But when they arrived late and tired , the person in charge told them it was not payed and if they wanted the room they needed to pay.. they were tired so they payed cash, asked for receipt and were told they would get it next morning... next morning "conveniently" the printer was not working , they were in a hurry and had to leave. Next week I got the charge in my card. Clearly they took advantage of these naive girls. I tried to get hotels.com to ask for a refund, called hundred times but since they could never talk to the manager nothing could be done. On top of it from the pictures they took it is a horrible hotel....linens were dirty they had to sleep on top of the comforter....... they were tired ...... what could they do ....

Reviews.Title: “they don't answer the phone after 8:00 pm”
Reviews.Author: Manchurian
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this hotel but my friend from India did - which is very unfortunate. They didn't carry a cell phone or a laptop with them. I called this hotel one evening to talk to him. I was told by the front desk staff they were not in the room. I gave my call-in information which was passed on to my friend. Since he didn't have a cell phone or email connection, he could not reach me. I tried again late at night as well as subsequent nights - nobody in the front desk picked up the phone. Later I came to know from my friend that front desk never transferred any calls to him though several of his friends (including myself) tried several times to reach him. What a terrible customer service! Later I called the hotel to convey my displeasure, the front desk guy was rude and refused to answer my questions. If you choose to stay in this hotel, please be aware of this terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “There was graffiti in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: bikesue
Reviews.Content: All the reviews that said this is the worst dump ever are correct. As most people, I suspect, I had to stay here because my flight arrived in at 2 am. The worst part was they charged $88 dollars (and we were only there for 6 hours- little did I know about the 4 hour $50 special some else 's review talked about). I have paid less to stay in really nice places in Snowmass (near Aspen), CO. What a disgusting rip-off. The hotel sites should really remove this listing.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug infested flea trap”
Reviews.Author: bschuess
Reviews.Content: We knew going in that this was not going to be five star experience, but it is possibly the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I overlook its worn trappings and lack of amenities, but after we settled in we noticed swarms of bed bugs throughout the room. A sign in the lobby reads "complaints about rooms will not be accepted after first 5 minutes"!!!!!. A lack of light bulbs in the bedroom fixtures made sighting the bedbugs difficult at first. Sleep in your car across the street in the Jewel/Osco parking lot for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: AdamAndDawn
Reviews.Content: We were driving in from 3 hours away to fly out of Chicago. Since we were going to be getting in late and flying out early, we decided to book an "economy" hotel. Worst decision ever made! First of all, we booked the hotel through a website. We were told that they had a park and ride and it was only going to cost us $20 for the duration we were gone. We arrived into our room to find both of the beds missing a leg and leaning to the side. We asked to move to a different room, which they were accommodating. The new room didn't have fitted sheets on the bed, the pillows smelled musty with stains on them (we covered the pillows with extra t-shirts we packed and just layed on top of the sheets without any covers...I wasn't about to use the bedspread with holes in it), the shower curtain was covered in mildew, i was scared to look at the rest of the place,and I woke up early the next morning to find 3 extra guests in our bed (looked like small roaches). The only reason we didn't go to a different hotel was because it was late and the kids were cranky. Plus, we figured we could handle a few hours. When we ended up leaving our car there (surprised to find it was still there when we came back on our return 10 days later) we found out it was $30 more than they originally told us. What could we do then since we were already there? Once we got back from our vacation, as soon as we landed, my husband called the shuttle to let them know we needed a ride. After about 30 minutes my husband called them to find out where they were in case we were in the wrong place. They told him the driver tried to call us but we didn't answer. This wasn't true because my husband had his cell in his hand the whole time and there wasn't a missed call notice. My husband confirmed the phone number with the guy dispatching the driver and was told the driver will be calling us soon. We never received a phone call. This went on for another 2 hours! We were finally told to just get a cab!! We already paid them for their service!!! By this time, it was 3:30am and we had been sitting on the curb for 3 hour with 2 very cranky kids (a 2 year old and a 10 month old). We were literally the last people out of the airport. We ended up having to pay an extra $15 to cram into a cab. When we got back to the hotel of course my husband had something to say to the manager. We were told the manager wasn't available and to call back the next day. Of course we didn't want to stay at that rat hole again and since it was so late (ER...early) we decided to just drive home 3 hours. When we called the next day, the manager said there was nothing he could do to accommodate us. We paid an extra $30 dollars for the park and ride than we were originally told, waited for over 2.5 hours for the shuttle to pick us up to be told to just get a cab, then paid an extra $15 just to get back to the hotel, then told they wouldnt reimburse us for the cab fair!! Mind you, my husband was very courteous (unlike i would have been) while dealing with these people. By this time, we could have stayed in a MUCH cleaner place for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this dunghole!”
Reviews.Author: accsucks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel through a travel site, it was listed as a comfort inn and with a different picture, imagine my disgust when the address led us to this!! From the time we walked in I wanted to leave. We got to our room and although we were very tired I refused to take off my clothes or shoes, I wanted to be ready to run! I didn't have a choice but to use the restroom and when I did, arrrgh, I closed the door and could only imagine what was all over the wall behind it, dripping down. That was it, We checked out and went straight to the airport and got the soonest flight out. When we returned home we called the travel sight and complained, amazingliy this hotel was no longer on their site. We were give a discount on our next travel arrangements through them, not likely! Too bad I couldn't rate this hotel in the negative!

Reviews.Title: “This motel had an accomodating staff and was in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloGrl1
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the nearby airport and called for a ride, the gentleman that came for me was prompt and courteous. He was not only the courtesy driver, but also the front desk manager and provided quality service in the busy motel that evening. The morning person provided misinformation to private driver the following day, as I entered the lobby she told driver there was no one there by my name.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: corunmila
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews of this place that were bad, but it still had 4 1/2 stars so I figured i must just be reading the bad ones. The pictures showed an older remodled motel, that looked ok. The amenities included free wi-fi, free contentinal breakfast and a jaccuzi. When I got there, It was in the middle of what looked to be a bad neighborhood. Thugs hanging out on the corner and such. The outside of the motel looked run down, the inside was jsut as bad, rundown. I had already pre reserved my room and had a no cancelation policy so I was stuck with the room. The room itself had filthy carpets, I wore my socks the whole time because I was afraid to take them off. I checked the beds for bugs and checked the sheets to see if they were calean and both passed. The bathroom was nothing like the pics on the web. It had granite tiles which looked real nice, but the rest of the bathroom was still a crap hole. I actually wore my socks in the shower cuz i didnt want to be bare foot in the tub. The room was cold because the outside night temp was 55 degrees, but no heat in the room. I complained and they told me the building heat was not on yet. I guess they only turn it on around november or later. I froze that night. After I got up and got dressed, I had to go take a poop, but I waited until I got to the gas station cuz I would rather sit on a public toilet than on the toilet in that room. I tried to log on to the internet but couldnt get a signal, I went up front and the guy up front got my computer a signal. but when I carried my laptop back to my room, i lost the signal. I suppose the only free wi-fi is in the looby. The free continentail breakfast turned out to be a box of cheerios, and a couple of peanut butter sandwiches sitting on a plate in the looby, with a gallon jug of milk, with only about 1 pint of milk in it, sitting on the counter at room tempature. Over all, I was glad I had only booked one night. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: highlandsjeff
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago on a budget and the Midway Inn fit. Yes, it could have been cleaner and more up to date BUT I didn't go to Chicago to sit in a hotel. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful and the location was great, it's a short walk to the train and bus that will take you downtown in about 15 or 20 min, it's close to the airport... I never felt unsafe. We read the reviews and saw the price, knew what we were getting into so we approached it with a very good attitude and had a really nice time.

Reviews.Title: “just BAD”
Reviews.Author: spljbonjay
Reviews.Content: if you value your health don't stay here. The carpet was wet and the air conditioner leaked water into the room. lots of mold. i changed rooms and it was just as bad. breakfast was a jar of peanut butter and a box of corn flakes.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!! Guaranteed to make your skin crawl!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmanphill
Reviews.Content: This is without a dirt the nastiest hotel/motel/inn that I have ever stayed in. Fist of all, when walking in, you can taste the cancer in the air! (That is how thick the smell of cigarette smoke is!) I should have known not to stay there when after checking in, the worker gave me the key to my room AND THE REMOTE TO THE TV!!! LOL We put our stuff down in the room and left immediately to get some dinner, as it was quite late. Upon returning, we get into the dim-lit room which had the furnishings of a one-night-stand stop. That includes a chewed piece of bubble gum in the shower, torn bath towels, a tray and ice bucket labeled from the Ramada hotel and soap bars from Super 8 Motel!! Not sure how they got those items, because I would bet my life that they don't have an agreement with any of those groups. I decided that I might just be very picky, and we decided to get some sleep since we were both very tired from our flight. But once we pulled back the blanket and found curly hair on the sheets and the pillow cases, I decided that I could not stay there, especially with my girlfriend. At 2 a.m. while waiting to speak with the attendant at the front desk, I was able to overhear a pleasant conversation where a respectable customer rents a room for the "four hour special" of $50. Upon doing so, his male friend enters followed by 2 very short and very plump ladies, and then off they all were to have what I can only figure to be a very quiet night of sleep, because what else would they be doing in a hotel room for 4 hours? Now to think that my girlfriend and I would be sleeping in the same bed as some guy who rented the room for 4 hours, and assuming that they so not clean the rooms every four hours, I was decidedly not going to stay there at all. I get to the front desk and complain to them that I will not stay in their hotel and that I wanted a refund as I had not even stayed there for 2 hours. I was promptly informed that according to the hotel policy, I had only 5 minutes after entering the room to decide whether I wanted to stay or not. When I told the attendant that we simply placed our bags in the room at midnight when we checked in, and went to get something to eat, she told me that the rule still applied. I told her to call the manager because I was not going to pay a thing (mind you they take full payment up front). She called the "manager" who was sleeping and decided not to come out, but told her that nothing could be done till the next day. I later found out that the manager ended up being the homeless looking fellow who was wandering the lobby in shorts and a torn T-Shirt when I was checking in. Needless to say we called a taxi immediately and went to the Holiday Inn Express just a few minutes away near to the Midway Airport. Spend the extra money and stay in a place where you wont get an STD from the sheets! Nothing is worth more while traveling than a clean hotel room and a respectable hotel in which to rest your head. NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!! If you respect yourself and your loved ones, you will not step foot into this cesspool!

Reviews.Title: “one word "Disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: mick009
Reviews.Content: As the title, this hotel will make you feel that. the first dissatisfaction you will face when you first open a room in this hotel is its smell. However, what would you expect from a little pay? For me, this is my first and last for this hotel. Pay more for the better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!! Stay very far away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dainutez
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin, because there were just soooooo many things that were wrong. The whole "hotel" stank of cigarette smoke. My room had dried vomit on the floor. The night stand was covered in some sort of sticky goo. Only one outlet worked, that was the one the TV and the bedside lights were plugged into. Needless to say in order to charge my cellphone I went without TV, which was fine because there was no remote control. No closet to hang clothing just some hooks on the wall. The bathroom had all the amenities. The sink had no counter space the toilet had no cover. I didn't dare step foot in the sink for fear that I would be infected by some bacteria. We were supposed to get continental breakfast with our stay. That was a joke. We had to ask for it and the front desk guy went to the Jewel Osco and bought some cereal. ON our way down to "breakfast" we stumbled upon what one could only call vomit on the stairs. NASTY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “By the hour....”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Advice-Jr
Reviews.Content: Maybe 40 years ago, this might have been a modest place. But she's fallen on hard times. Upcharged on my "gauranteed" rate upon arrival. Airport shuttle runs to the airport every two hours beginning at 4a and ending at either 8a or 10a (not too convenient but better than nothing). Exceedingly thin walls as we could hear the conversation next door. And one non-clean bathroom with very thin towels. Was in the lobby for a total of three minutes and encountered two oldest profession women. Pretty good looking but probably not the clientele you might encounter in a $70-80 per night "inn." The good news is that there's a grocery store across the street (there were no stocked / working vending machines), a good hot dog place two doors down, nice enough staff, and it's really close to Midway Airport (five-seven minutes drive). So if you're looking for an experience, oldest profession women, or something really close to Midway, book it. Otherwise, you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Foodtrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property....not at all as promised; wireless is not in room, only in lobby; free breakfast does not include coffee--you have to pay 50 cents in the lobby; bathroom shower was poorly maintained; no place to hang clothes on the wall--when I complained, they put up a coat rack, not a rack where you can use a hanger; lobby and hallways reeked of cigarette smoke; lobby was remodeled, but hallways had either poorly laid tile on the first floor or badly stained carpeting on the second floor; TV had XXX-rated hard core porn showing free on Channel 4, right where you expect a local channel to be--no warning. Phones in rooms do not allow outgoing calls; must use phone in lobby. My room was not cleaned the first day and I was informed that it was my fault as I didn't expressly request my room be cleaned (isn't it usually the other way around--the default is to clean it?). This property should be rated NO STARS......

HotelInfo.Name: Midway Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5335 S Pulaski Rd, Chicago, IL 60632
